summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorneys and Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney Christian Everdell regarding concerns about an unannounced DOJ visit to Maxwell at MDC and the status of a replacement hard drive containing discovery materials. The defense asserts Maxwell cannot participate in her defense without access to discovery.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell, emails prosecutors to prevent DOJ representatives from speaking with Maxwell without counsel present and to expedite delivery of a discovery hard drive.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client represented by Christian Everdell, incarcerated at MDC, awaiting discovery materials to review for her defense.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Cc'd on the email from Christian Everdell, presumably part of Maxwell's defense team at Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Cc'd on the email from Christian Everdell, presumably part of Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Cc'd on the email from Christian Everdell, presumably part of Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Holly Prates
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York corresponding about the DOJ visit inquiry and the status of the discovery hard drive.

connections.description: Everdell is explicitly identified as the attorney representing Maxwell, advocating for her legal rights regarding discovery and interviews.
Both are attorneys at Cohen & Gresser LLP, with Cohen cc'd on the legal correspondence.
Prosecutor and defense attorney communicating about case logistics (DOJ visit, discovery delivery).
Prosecutor from the office charging Maxwell, involved in managing discovery and access to the defendant.

events.title: Planned DOJ Visit to Maxwell at MDC
events.description: Maxwell advised her attorneys that representatives from the DOJ would be meeting with her at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC); defense counsel seeks to ensure no interview occurs without counsel present.

events.title: Replacement Discovery Hard Drive Sent
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's office sent a replacement hard drive containing discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC, as requested by her defense.

events.title: Deadline for Initial Discovery Tranche
events.description: The court-ordered deadline for the prosecution to complete the initial production of discovery materials to the defense, which had passed without Maxwell receiving all materials.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney, Christian Everdell, raised an alarm about an unannounced planned visit by DOJ representatives to Maxwell at MDC, insisting no interview occur without counsel present.

Maxwell had not received a replacement hard drive containing discovery materials sent by prosecutors on September 3, 2020, hindering her ability to review evidence for her defense more than two weeks past the August 21 discovery deadline.

The correspondence reveals logistical and access issues in Maxwell's pretrial detention, including communication between her defense team and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The defense emphasizes Maxwell's right to participate in her defense is compromised without access to the discovery materials.
